country:
None
text:
After making this recipe a few times I've tweeked it just a little bit. I make it with 6 oz of gourmet spicy Diana bbq sauce and then 6 oz of the regular so that its not too spicy. I add the other ingredients as listed and i also add a small diced onion and some liquid smoke (it really does make a difference). After about 4 hrs of cooking i shred the chicken and add about 1tbsp of cornstarch to thicken the sauce. I serve it over mashed potatoes (made with milk, butter, and diced onions) and chedder cheese on top. It tastes so yummy! Its my favourite recipe on this site. and if you put it all together in a container its tastes just as good the next day!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674161.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I love this recipe! I've made it both ways. First way: frozen chicken cooked in bbq sauce mixture. Second way: chicken cooked in broth, then liquid drained, meat shredded, and bbq sauce added to cooked meat. 

While it takes a little extra time, it's definitely worth it to cook the chicken first, before adding the bbq sauce mixture, for several reasons: 1) The chicken tastes better. 2) The sauce is less runny (this is especially important if you're making sandwiches) 3) It's easier to see extra "stuff" that needs to be thrown out when you're shredding the chicken, 4) you get rid of extra fat, since that gets drained off rather than mixed in with the bbq sauce.

Either way, this recipe is a winner. I made it as directed 4-5 times before following the reviewers' advice and cooking the chicken separately. When I tested the finished product (cooked the new way), I was so excited that I started dancing around the kitchen. Literally.

btw - the dressing/bbq sauce really do matter. I use Sweet Baby Ray's bbq sauce and Ken's Steak House Zesty Italian dressing.
Review:
Rating:
4

text:
I made this recipe pretty much by the book, and only added slight modifications. I used 4 chicken breasts and used Tony Roma original BBQ sauce. I left my crockpot on low while at work and unfortunately that was still too hot bc when I got home, it had started to burn the sauce. To help fix, I added additional brown sugar, a little garlic and about 3/4 cup of a Smoked BBQ sauce to help get rid of the burned flavor.  Ishredded the chicken, mixed it all together and served on rolls topped with some good hotsauce and it was absolutely wonderful. I will make again but will keep the crockpot on warm instead of low!

text:
This recipe is easy and delicious! I threw five boneless chicken breasts in the crockpot in the morning, along with the other ingredients, turned it on low, and when we got home from work, dinner was waiting for us. The meat was incredibly tender and the flavor was fabulous. My only change was that I used 1/4 cup of Good Seasons zesty Italian dressing because it's all I had.

text:
This recipe was excellent. I read a number of reviews that talked about adding chicken stock so I did, but it was unnecessary and resulted in the chicken being a little too wet. Still the sauce was great and we like things extra saucy so it wasn't a problem.  Cooked it on low for about 7 hours and the chicken was perfectly moist and falling apart.  I shredded the chicken, put it back into the sauce, and served it over rice. Will make it again and again. (I used Bull's Eye original bbq sauce and Bernstein's Light Balsamic vinegrette dressing).  I have a lot of leftovers, so I am making BBQ chicken pizza tonight.

text:
This turned out really well!  I put the chicken in frozen, salt/peppered the breasts, covered them completely with chicken broth, cooked on high for about 2 1/2 hours.  Took out the chicken and pulled it apart, mixed all the ingredients, and added a little bit of liquid smoke.  It was awesome!  Served it on toasted onion rolls with baked beans and cole slaw as appetizers.  Beer is a must with this dinner!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was fabulous! I cooked twice the amount of meat used in the recipe (big crowd) so I needed twice as much sauce. I used two different BBQ sauces, both really good quality. I didn't have quite enough ranch dressing, so I substituted some parmesan peppercorn. I cooked it on high just until it was good and hot, then pushed it back to low for several hours. At the end of cooking I pulled the chicken out and shredded it, putting it back into the sauce to moisten and absorb more tangy goodness for about 30 minutes. We had it with slow cooker mac & cheese. Deeeelish! We had it another night with garlic mashed potatoes- ooooohhhhh so gooood! The left overs that I froze will be enjoyed with corn bread and green beans- which I'm sure will be to die for. This is something that will be gracing our table several times this winter, as well as next summer when I'm craving moist, tangy BBQ without all the work! A winner that should be in everyone's recipe box!

text:
I made this for a weekend gathering and it was wonderful. I did make a few small changes. I doubled the sauce. I added minced garlic, green onion, and a little bit of diced yellow onion. I cooked on low for about 5 hours and then on high for one hour. I shredded it and cooked it on low for another hour. It was so full of flavor and moist! I served it on rolls with baked potatos, baked beans, and fried okra. I have to agree with everyone else...as wonderful as this is the first day...it is even better the second day! Thanks for a super easy family pleasing recipe!!!

text:
Made fantastic shredded "pulled" chicken sandwiches!  I used 6 frozen skinless breasts and checked after 4 hours on low.  The chicken was cooked and already a tad dry so I decided to shred it.  I left the shredded chicken on warm for another hour and it was excellent.  I used Buster's bbq sauce (a local BBQ joint), served on pub buns with coleslaw.  There are probably better pulled chicken recipes, but the ease of this one make it a definite 5 star!

text:
This chicken turns out fabulously when done in the slow cooker and shredded, and also when baked in the oven and then broiled for the last few minutes. I've made this with a whole chicken in a slow cooker, cserved the slices of chicken for dinner that night, adn then shredded the rest of the meat for sandwiches later on. Cooking this chicken in the oven and then broiling for the last few minutes is a great substitute for those who cannot grill!

text:
Very happy with this recipe! Fast-easy-tasty-what could be better? I altered it a bit by using about 3 lbs of boneless, skinless thighs. I seared them quickly on high heat with a bit of olive oil before going into the crock pot. I used fat free Italian dressing (which I never use but thought for a sauce it would be fine...and it was!) Put seared chicken thighs in pot, top with sauce. I had it on high for about 3-3.5 hours and it was perfect. Removed chicken pulled it apart with 2 forks, placed on grilled hoagie rolls & topped with the sauce. Everyone loved it...a keeper!

By far one of my favorite recipes! It is a bit sweet so I have started adding a tad less brown sugar. Will be making very regularly, very easy and normally have all the ingredients on hand.

text:
Made this for a  get together with another couple to watch hockey, and it was a hit!  I used fresh, not frozen, chicken breasts with the ingredients exactly as listed, cooked it on high for 3 hours, then shredded the chicken, stirred it back in and cooked another hour on low, as was suggested by another reviewer.  It sat a bit longer as I made a salad and cooked some potatoes in the microwave.  It was not too "liquid-y" as other reviewers mentioned.   My husband had his on a bun, and the rest of us put some on top of a half of a baked potato with some shredded cheese.  I will definitely make it again.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe is a great starting point for perfect pulled bbq chicken.  I made a few changes:  1) used a tried and true sauce (Jones Sisters), though I think it would be worth the effort to make my own going forward, 2) added 3 cloves of minced garlic and a thinly sliced Vidalia to the sauce, 3) skipped the Italian dressing and added 1/2 bottle of dark beer instead, 4) cooked 5 chicken breasts on high for 3 hours, shredded the meat and returned to the crock pot on low for an hour, 5) served on brioche buns with cheddar and dill pickle slices.  Enjoy!

Yummy & Easy!!! I used a frozen package of chicken breast cutlets... thawed and cleaned. Billy Rays Honey BBQ (left out the brown sugar.) Used Lea & Perrins, Zesty Italian dressing, added chopped onion, garlic powder and salt & pepper. Cooked in crock pot for two hours. Then shredded chicken. Cooked another hour before removing cover to cook down the liquid for the last 45 mins to an hour... (stirring occasionally.) SO GOOD! Even my picky housemate keeps raving about it. Left-overs are great, so make the whole batch up!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Was very good! The addition of salad dressing was so useful. Adding just enough extra flavor. Just an FYI on bottled bbq sauce package may say 20 ounces net weight but not all are true. When I measured the sauce for the 12 oz on the ingredients that 20 oz bottle was really 12 ounces of product. I did call the company and they confirmed the info on the bottle included packaging weight also. I was very disappointed with that fact. Had absolutely no negative effect on flavour. I am keeping this for future meals. Thank you for the great recipe.
Review:
Rating:

text:
I followed the directions as written. There was so much liquid and chicken didn’t have much flavor. After shredding, it was put back in empty crockpot on low, and cooking liquid was placed in saucepan and simmered until reduced by half. 
When poured onto chicken it was just right. 
Served with hamburger buns, sliced red onion, coleslaw, dill pickles and kettle chips. 
I will make it again, but will cook chicken with some seasoning. Then I will pour the sauce over skipping the reduction step. 
Overall, we were very pleased with the recipe.

text:
I made this last night, and my family loved it! I used 3 huge frozen breasts that I halved to get the 6 breasts, so it only took about 5 hours on low to cook thoroughly. However,  I left it in for 6 hours and just spooned the sauce over all of the pieces every so often to keep it moist until my family arrived home for dinner (*and for the last hour, I turned the setting down to the “Serve” setting  to keep it from over-cooking in order to get to the 6 hour mark). I bought the Sweet Baby Ray’s BBQ sauce, Brown sugar (Baker’s Corner), and a bottle of the Italian salad dressing (Tuscan Garden) from Aldis. The Worcestershire Sauce was Giant Eagle’s brand. I’m telling you, my son liked it so much he wanted a sandwich for breakfast this morning. The bun is important too... I used Brioche Buns from Aldis as well because they are delicious. Good luck!

OMG y'all!! I made this tonight... changed it a tad. I added about three teaspoons of minced garlic, about a teaspoon of liquid hickory smoke.. mind you I got these ideas from reading everyone else reviews. ok. okkkay!... I let it slow cook the six hours. followed the rest of the recipe to a tea... wait!! pause!! I didn't use frozen chicken nope..., I used five pack of chicken from the grocery store, defrosted but made sure to clean it before and wash it down before I put it in the slow cooker ok.. but still.. slow cooked it and followed the recipe besides adding the garlic and smoke flavoring. after the six hours..I broke the chicken apart inside the cooker,  added the rest of the 19 oz. Jack Daniels barbecue I bought, but mixed it with a tblspoon of corn starch to thicken the sauce a bit. I think good barbecue bought sauce is the better option.  Chiiillld, it is fricken amazing tasting and so easy to make!! recommend to everyone!!  made baked potatoes on the side, swipied then down with some oil Olive and kosher salt and garlic. baked them about an hour like you know how to do... amazing!! koodos to the lady who came up with this recipe. I'm new to cooking and you just made me so happy!! I'll for sure be doing this again.. and again.. and again

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/6445820.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I am floored at how delicious this turned out. I was afraid it would be too mushy or soupy like some had pointed out. What I did is I pressure cooked it for 30 mins (not sure of the temp, just selected “poultry” on my slow cooker). By then the chicken was already cooked, but needed to be shredded and soak in the flavors. So I slow cooked it for three hours on low... omg y’all. SO tender, SUPER flavorful!!! Not at all soupy. I made sure the sauce didn’t drown out the chicken before letting it slow cook. I wanted to use the recommended BBQ sauce but I used Jack Daniel’s hickory BBQ sauce instead :) Also thew in some chopped onions and a few slices of bacon to really amp it up. Add a buttery, toasted bun and you’re all set. I paired it with cream corn+Caesar salad. Yum X a million :)

country:
None
text:
So Simple! Wanted more so...Placed all of the 2.5 pound bag of Perdue's frozen chicken breasts in crockpot. Sprinkled salt,pepper,garlic seasoning over each side of frozen breast. 
Mixed full 18 oz. Bottle of Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce,
and recipe stated amounts of Italian Dressing,Worcestershire sauce and brown sugar in bowl.
Put liquid bbq sauce mixture into crockpot and stirred in.
Cooked on High for 3 hours.Pulled each breast into a jowl..and using 2 forks...pulled chicken.
Returned all pulled.Chicken to crockpot..Mixed and cooked an hour more on low.
Perfect! Very lean and YUMMY.!!
Made sliders with Kings Hawaiian Rolls!
EVERYONE LOVED IT!

userID:
410576
Display Name:
Spyce
isPro:
False
followersCount:
50
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
89
favoritesCount:
733
recipesCount:

reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1026596.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this in my Ninja 4-in-1. I changed it a bit by sautéing half a sliced onion in the pot along with a couple of sliced hot peppers on Stovetop High for abut 3 minutes. I also thawed and seasoned my chicken. After sautéing the onion and peppers, I turn the Ninja off, added the chicken and stirred in the sauces and honey. I used a tablespoon of honey instead of 1/4 cup of brown sugar.  I set the Ninja to Slow Cook - Low and cooked the chicken for three hours (my pot was already hot). After it was done, I removed the chicken and shredded it. Meanwhile, I set the Ninja back to Stovetop High and cooked the sauce down a bit, and then added in the shredded chicken. Delicious! If you're using a really sweet barbecue sauce like Sweet Baby Ray's, you may want to cut back on the sugar a bit. I used my homemade sauce which is already sweet and using just a tablespoon of honey (as noted above) was plenty. Also, the newer slow cookers cook a lot faster than the older ones so the cooking times listed in the recipe may need adjusting if you have a newer cooker.
Review:

text:
I would give this more stars if i could. ?? I've made it a couple times now and have learned it's a very forgiving recipe. The first time i made it I ended up leaving it in the slow cooker way longer than i should have because our shopping trip ran long. It was still moist and tasted great. (I keep all the juice and allow the chicken to soak it all up after I've chopped it.) 

The only change i made was to use light balsamic vinaigrette as that's what i had on hand. 

This is easy to prepare and great for big groups or potlucks! Serve with coleslaw and it's a perfect summer meal.

country:
None
text:
This was very good. I was skeptical because I've cooked chicken breasts in the crock pot before and after shredding it was somewhat dry. However I followed this recipe exactly and it turned out pretty tender and juicy. I cooked mine on low for 6 hours and then it was kept on warm for a couple more hours until I got home from work. The recipe didn't specify to shred in the pot or remove and then shred, so after seeing the amount of liquid I decided to remove the meat to a separate dish, shred, then added a scoop at a time of the liquid until it had the consistency I wanted. Considering how easy this is I'd recommend trying it.

Display Name:
kimberlykiwi

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614246.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've made this a few times now. I read through reviews and took some advice. I use three large chicken breasts without changing the sauce ingredient amounts and it's a perfect ratio every time. I've used fresh and frozen chicken. I don't think it matters in terms of taste but it does change my time a little bit. Just adjust to your own typical crockpot cook times. I use a Kansas City style bbq sauce from Private Selections and wow. It is truly elevated. This is a crowd pleaser. My kids love it and ask for seconds. Even my husband who isn't a bbq fan says it's alright which is a compliment from him. I serve this on a wheat bun topped with mayonnaise, thinly sliced onions, chopped dill pickles and shredded colby jack cheese. Goes great with sides like potato salad, corn on the cob, fresh salad, etc. This makes great leftovers for lunch the next day too. I actually think it's even better the second day. Excellent recipe to add to my rotation.
Review:
Rating:
5

text:
I made this as written except I used only 4 very large thawed, chicken breasts.  For added flavor, I also added chopped green pepper, onion and garlic.  There was a lot of watery sauce that I had to remove and add cornstarch to so it would thicken.  That would be my only complaint about this recipe.  The flavor was good, but the sauce was too watery...and not red and saucy like other BBQ chicken.

text:
This is delicious! Kids love it too. Has become part of my rotation. Seemed an odd combination of flavors at first but I am glad I tried it. I have used regular italian, also Ken's steak house light raspberry vinaigrette. Both successful.  I use Sweet Baby Ray's honey bbq sauce. Recipe makes a ton of sauce which I hate to throw out so I usually cut all ingredients in half except for the chicken   Chicken breasts tend to be dry so I often use chicken thighs instead for all slow cooker meals. Frozen cooks without an issue.

I have been making this for a couple of years and finally joined so I can leave some reviews as I rely heavily on reviews myself.

This has to be one of the easiest recipes I have ever made. You don't even have to defrost your frozen chicken breasts before hand. By preparing this and your sides before hand you spend 100% of your time with your family and guests rather than in the kitchen. I served it to some friends last night and it was a big hit. photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674156.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Ok, this was THE easiest recipe I've EVER made so as it was cooking I was thinking of all the things I could've added and that this can only be 3-4 stars as is. I was wrong! Yes, next time if I have it I'll add an onion & some garlic powder, but I will make this again as written too. I did however only have 2 chicken breast halves so I cut the recipe by 3rds; because of this, I added 2-3 tablespoons of chicken stock to the slow cooker after adding sauce because the slow cooker was too wide for just 2 breasts & little sauce. It worked out perfectly! I do agree that you have to watch the time--I cooked it on low for 3-4 hours, then shredded it & let it cook 1-2 hours longer then turned to warm (the temp was only about 130 in the thickest part of the breast before shredding). I also used a liner for easy cleaning (I don't particularly love them, but I had some to use up). I still can't believe how easy AND how good this was. I used Open Pit "thick & tangy" BBQ sauce which gave it a smokey spicy undertone--delicious!

text:
Yummy!!! I made this with a few pointers from fellow AR users. Added frozen chopped onion and bell pepper, used 6 frozen chicken breast’s and a great Famous Dave’s BBQ sauce. I also “broiled” the buns in the oven. It went for about a total of 8 hours and after 6 is when we pulled it out and shredded the meat. At the end, due to the sweetness, I add some cayenne pepper. Just my choice. Then, for those who wanted it, I offered hot sauce. It was fabulous and I can’t wait to have the leftovers tomorrow! It was so moist and flavorful! Give it a try - it will be your new favorite! I know it’s replacing my old recipe!

text:
I had a freezer full of chicken breasts from a sale, and my husband was complaining about always having chicken and asked me for something else, anything else, as long as it wasn't chicken. This recipe was so good, not only did he stop complaining,  but he didn't even think it was chicken. After shredding, I like to let it soak in the sauce on warm for an hour or so after. It's even better the next day. You can use this recipe with boneless skinless chicken thighs too, or a mixture of thighs and breasts. My chicken-hating husband asks for this all the time now. He thinks it's pulled pork.

text:
I used thawed chicken & place in crockpot. Mix up the rest ingredients in bowl & pour over chicken, cooking on low for 3 to 4 hrs. Take chicken out & shred or cut into pieces adding back to sauce, and cook one hour more. I added 1/2 cup chopped onions, 3 garlic cloves, used Jack Daniels BBQ sauce, & served over rice. Absolutely fantastic meal that my family loves & everyone gets the recipe from me. Thanks

text:
I find this recipe to be very forgiving-- I used whatever sauces were in the fridge (but didn't skimp or cheap out on the BBQ sauce), and both times I made it were great. I used chicken breasts the first time and thighs the second-- I preferred the taste of the thighs. Be sure to check at semi-regular intervals to avoid overcooking. This also reheats very well-- I made big batch then had it for the next three days' lunches with sweet and sour pickles on the side.

country:
None
text:
This was so easy!  I read a lot of reviews 1st.  I used 4 large defrosted breasts, sprinkled them with garlic salt and put them in the crock pot with about 1/3 cup chicken broth and cooked them on high for 3 hours.  I then drained the chicken broth, shredded the chicken (it fell apart), returned to the crock pot with the bbq sauce (I omitted the brown sugar for fear it would be too sweet) and turned it to low for another hour.  This is a good solid bbq recipe and gets 4 stars bc it was sooo easy!!

text:
My husband is not a "chef".  As a matter of fact, he just retired and just started cooking to assist me around the house.  I chose this recipe for him to try and I was shocked!  It was SOOOOO Good!  We only had three chicken breasts so we cut the ingredients in half.  He first simmered in chicken in chicken broth with garlic, pepper, and "maybe" other spices.  He then drained it then added the listed ingredients.  He cut the brown sugar by more than a half.  Also, he used the Sweet Baby BBQ and Olive Garden dressing.  If a rookie can do this, anyone can.  Try it!  It's so good!

Great Recipe. I would suggest not adding the sauce mixture immediately, waiting until the chicken is 30-60 minutes done from cooking, draining the excess chicken juice, and then adding the sauce. This way, it's not so watery while still being nice and juicy.

text:
Used 3 huge chicken breasts.  Made the sauce exactly as written.  Cooked on high for 4 hours then shredded the chicken, added a tbsp of flour to thicken, and cooked on low for about another hour.  The sauce thickened up nicely.  Served on buttered & broiled whole wheat hamburger buns with a slice of smoked provolone.  OMG, this was absolutely delicious!  Used Sweet Baby Ray's honey bbq sauce and cheap-o Italian dressing.  Definitely a keeper!

text:
What do you do when you are under the weather and still want to make dinner? I felt awful but I had to make 4 chicken breasts before they walked out of the frig by themselves. The breasts were large, bone-in and the skin had not been removed. I just threw them in the cooker just as they were. I didn't have Italian dressing on hand so I used some balsamic dressing I did have. I cooked it 6 hours on low. The sauce came out thinner than I wanted (an easy fix) but the chicken was wonderful! I served the chicken and sauce over rice along with some baked cabbage. I will make again. This recipe has possibilities and is a keeper.

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674154.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is an easy recipe that tastes great for all ages, and makes chicken for days...  The only alterations I made were to cook the chicken in chicken broth for 4 hours on high heat.  Then I pulled the chicken out to shred and discarded the broth in the slow cooker.  I then mixed in an 18 oz. jar (rather than the 16 oz. jar) of Stubb's Original BBQ sauce, because my chicken breasts looked really big.  It was perfect.  They were wet, but not over-sauced.  Delicious.  We ate on hoagie rolls with provolone as sandwiches. I made wraps out of it for lunch, and even stuck them on Nachos for the Super Bowl.  Delicious.

text:
I made a few changes to this recipe based off of other reviews that I read. I added 1/2 cup of smokey BBQ sauce and reduced the amount of maple syrup as I don't like too much sweet stuff in my food. I used frozen chicken breasts and cooked on high for 4 hrs then turned to low for another 4 hrs. Doubled the sauce recipe and put 1/4 aside - used some to put directly on the sandwich buns. It turned out great for my pot luck luncheon at work. It was the first crock pot to be emptied. All my colleagues have asked for the recipe and raved about how good it was! I will definitely be using this recipe for other types of meat as well. It will be in my recipe box from now on. Was so simple to make and great tasting! Not too sweet or sticky like some other recipes I've tried!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614259.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
My family loved this barbecue chicken. I made a few changes to the recipe. I used three boneless chicken breasts that I thawed almost completely in the microwave prior to placing in the crock pot. I also did not have Italian dressing on  hand so I substituted with the ranch dressing i did have. I figured this would also aid in thickening the sauce. I did not use top of the line barbecue sauce. I used Kraft slow simmered mesquite smoked barbecue sauce because this is what I had on hand. I cooked the chicken in the crock pot with the sauce mixture for 3 hours on high. I then shredded the chicken and placed it back into the crock pot, stirring well. Set it for 1 hr  on low.  The sauce was perfect. Served it on flat bread with sharp cheddar cheese. This made enough for three people with leftovers.

text:
This came out really well. I used 4 chicken breast (so 8 breast halves) which was fine since I had an 18 oz bottle of Stubbs BBQ sauce.. I upped the amounts on the other ingredients just a bit. I had it on low in the crockpot for about 4.5 hours then took out the chicken halves and shredded them. I added it back to the crockpot for another hour or so that way the shredded chicken could soak up the sauce. Put it on sandwich rolls with some coleslaw. Absolutely amazing meal which both my husband and I really enjoyed.

text:
Delicious! I like mine a bit "saucier", so I used four (fresh) chicken breasts, 18oz of barbecue sauce and 3/4 C (Olive Garden) Italian Dressing.  Because the chicken was fresh, I cooked on low for three hours, shredded the chicken, then cooked on low for one more hour. That night we put the chicken on rolls and topped with ranch or bleu cheese dressing. The following night we made quesadillas with the chicken, adding shredded cheddar.  Easy and flavorful.

text:
I made this recipe as written (except I used thawed chicken breasts), wanted to love it due to the reviews, but was really underwhelmed.  I used Montgomery Inn barbecue sauce.  Like another reviewer, I added some Wondra flour to thicken the watery sauce, (I did shred the chicken 3/4 way through) and felt I needed to keep adding more barbecue sauce to get the flavor boost.  I will try this again, but with adjustments.  One suggestion - add some sliced banana peppers or pickles to your sandwich, it really "brings it home".

text:
Having been  member of All Recipes for years, when I read this recipe, was sure it would be a hit for Christmas Eve 2016.  Rarely, however, do I try anything new for such an important occasion.

Changed recipe slightly. Added more chicken.  Used Masterpiece BBQ sauce as this is our favorite.  After cooking and shredding chicken ... there was way too much sauce so I took out half of sauce and returned chicken to crock pot.  Served on homemade hoagie buns.  This was a hit to say the least.  Definitely will make this again ... won't wait for Christmas either.  

Note:  Always use good ingredients; good sauce, good dressing, etc.

text:
Great recipe for game night or a pot luck.  You MUST know your slow cooker.  They are not created equal and some cook way too hot even at the lowest setting.  Put some water in your slow cooker on low setting.  If it boils,  your slow cooker is too hot.  Chances are you've overcooked a lot of dishes in it.

This recipe should be a snap, if you have a slow cooker with adequate temp control.

text:
Simple and clean, a very easy recipe for our favourite easy cooking tool, the slow cooker.  Taking the advice of Cooking101, I cooked my chicken for 6 hours in chicken broth.  However, I did adjust the recipe slightly by seasoning my chicken with italian dressing dry powder mix, as I was lacking in the liquid dressing.  Otherwise, I proceeded with the dish as normal and found it to be a tasty and easy meal.  If I would offer any advice, it's that the sauce is going to make buns a soggy mess in a hurry, so you'd do well to either broil 'em a bit before serving or choosing a base that holds together longer!

city:

country:
None
text:
Oh my. Everyone I make this for LOVES it! One trick that really helps with keeping flavor potent, is to add only about 1/3 of the sauce ingredients initially. Then, after the chicken is cooked through, take out the chicken pieces only. Dump the liquid. (As the chicken cooks, it releases a lot of water which waters down the flavor and makes the sauce very runny.) Shred the chicken and put back in the crock pot on warm, then add the remaining 2/3 of the sauce ingredients, stir and it's ready whenever you are.

I did as Cooking 101 suggested.   I cut the recipe in half and cooking the frozen, trimmed breasts in chicken broth with Nature season, poultry season and garlic powder for 6 hours on low.  I poured off the broth, added remaining ingredients and cooked on low for another 2 hours.  My youngest daughter and myself liked it.  My picky oldest daughter did not.  I am freezing the leftovers and when I reheat it I will saute some onions and garlic before adding the leftovers.  Overall, a good recipe.  Changes are based on personal taste.  Thank you.

text:
LOVED this! I've been on allrecipes.com for about 100 years and this is the first time I'm leaving a review because this is going to be in my faves file for sure! I even simplified it by just putting in fresh chicken breasts (4 large) and then just dumped the sauce ingredients on top of the chicken (eliminating having to wash a separate bowl) and turned on high for 4 hours. It all melded together and sauce seemed too thin until I shredded the chicken and then it was perfect! I am not a fan of leftovers but I brought a container to work today and it's so good I'm eating it cold! But for dinner, we had it on nice hamburger rolls and some of us topped with cheese and pickles. Would be good with some slaw on top and a side of baked beans. I think you could make it more complicated with onions and garlic and others stuff but it isn't needed if you want a quick easy dinner that tastes awesome!

text:
Love this recipe.  For the person who said the cooking time was too long...I have a hint.  Take the lid off the crock pot every now and then and check the chicken.  Whether the recipe says it takes 4-6-8 hours...when it done, its done.  That's when you unplug the slow cooker.  I cant say for sure but I would be willing to bet that actual temperature ranges vary from brand to brand. I'm sorry but it is common sense.

I'm always looking for recipes calling for frozen chicken breasts, un-thawed, because I never remember to thaw. That said, I did use fresh chicken breasts this time and cooked on HIGH for 3 1/2 hours, shredded, then left on LOW for about another hour. Soaked up a lot of the sauce and was really flavorful! I followed the recipe exactly, I made my own Italian dressing from a seasoning packet because I was out of bottled, and used Jack Daniel's Original BBQ sauce: I agree with other reviewers, the BBQ sauce is an important choice! We will be using the leftovers for something tasty! Thanks for the simple, easy and delicious recipe. Yummy!

text:
Used frozen chicken breasts and cooked on high for 4 hours. Didn't have Worcestershire on hand so I added a splash of red wine vinegar and an extra pinch of salt. I took out the chicken about 3.5 hours in and shredded it. While the chicken was out, I added 3 tablespoons of flour to thicken up the sauce, beware of pesky clumps though. Then I put the shredded chicken back in to soak up that flavor. After a taste I decided to add some crushed red pepper flakes to add some heat (I'd recommend).

text:
Quick and easy and tasty too. I loved that I had a use for my frozen chicken breasts because many times if I freeze meat, it doesn't get used. My husband is always critical of slow-cooker meals, but he loved this. I made it exactly as listed in the recipe. Next time, I'll make some modifications to see if I can make it without the BBQ sauce so the chicken can be used for a variety of meals. There are a lot of leftovers so if I could spin it Mexican after, it would be perfect.  Not sure if that will come out as juicy though. Oh and some people commented that they don't use frozen breasts in the slow cooker but this was my first time and I did it on low for 9 hours and texture/doneness was great. My slow cooker seems to run hot so a lot of times my chicken comes out dry or gummy at the end when using fresh chicken breasts.

text:
This is such a hit! I use fresh chicken breasts (not frozen) and sprinkle a little garlic powder on them before going into the slow cooker. I always use Sweet Baby Ray’s barbecue sauce and Kraft Zesty Italian dressing. Add a dash of cayenne pepper for a little kick! Cooked on high for 3-4 hours. Make sure to shred the chicken halfway through and had back to the sauce to really amp up the flavor and absorb well. Goes great on toasted Brioche buns with giardiniera peppers, if desired!

text:
Fantastic.  I did this the fast way.  I just dumped everything in my pressure cooker, locked the lid, set the timer for 45 minutes, and walked away.  Once the 45 minutes of pressure was up, I shredded the chicken in the pot and cooked on "low temp" for 15 minutes to allow the sauce to absorb in and thicken.   Wonderful, easy dinner that only requires 10 minutes of actual work.  

This recipe works with chicken, pork, or beef.  I use 45 minutes for chicken, 50 for pork, and 60 for beef.  All the other ingredients remain the same.  To make the pork and beef cook better and more evenly, I slice the roast against the grain into 1 inch slabs.  A pork roast is my favorite with this recipe.  We eat it on buns one night, and over baked potatoes the next.

5

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Excellent. I would recommend using Sweet Baby Ray's and cutting the brown sugar. I added a few splashes of cider vinegar, three cloves of garlic, onion powder, salt, pepper and some hot sauce to spice it up a little bit. 

Cooking times are off. I scoured the comments here and what worked best for me (Fall apart chicken pulling it out of the pot to shred) was doing 4 hours on low, pulling the chicken and shredding, then returning to pot. I cranked the heat up to a medium and left the lid ajar and cooked for an additional hour or so. If you need to you can sprinkle a teaspoon or so of corn starch to thicken it up if you prefer. 

Came out excellent. It's going into the regular rotation for sure.

text:
I have made this twice, following the recipe for the most part.  Last time I didn't use as much chicken as the first time (I think I used 4 chicken breasts first time) and the recipe works better with the 4 chicken breasts for my family.  Makes it, predictably, less saucy.  Also I cooked on high this last time, which left some parts burnt.  So, next time I'll err on the side of MORE chicken and cooking it longer on Low.  The flavor is great, and I'm never buying the pre-packaged barbecue chicken again.  I'm sure this is cheaper, and probably healthier.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/4717995.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
i have made this multiple times over the last couple of years and have always gotten rave reviews about it.  As others have said you HAVE to use a good quality BBQ sauce. If you do use frozen chicken it probably will be a little watery as the chicken releases more moisture than if you use thawed or fresh chicken. One solution I have found is to cook the frozen chicken with about half the BBQ sauce until it shreds easily, empty at least half of the liquid, shred chicken, and then put it back in the slow cooker with the remainder of the BBQ sauce for at least an hour on low. One of the changes I have made over the years is that I use half breast and half thigh meat (IMO meat stays moister than if using all breast).

text:
This was excellent!  I followed some other reviewers suggestions and added a squirt of liquid smoke,  1 tsp of minced garlic and and 1/2 tsp onion power to the mix, using Sweet Baby Rays BBQ Sauce.  After pouring the mix over the chicken, I refrigerated the chicken for 4 hours.  I didn't use all the sauce and saved some for a future dinner. Then I cooked the chicken in a slow cooker on high for 3 hrs and then on low for an hour.   I cooked 4 jumbo chicken wings, and a chicken breast.  I didn't shred it, but it was falling off the bone.   I served it over rice and loved it.

Used 2 types of BBQ - omitted the Worcester sauce I didn't have any and used only a little Italian dressing.  Added a big dash of liquid smoke.  Made in a 16oz glass and used maybe 12oz over the raw chicken.  Cooked covered and on low for 6 hrs.  When I came back to check on it it was super liquidy which was fine.  I drained the sauce, cooked it down in a sauce pan in 3-4 mins as I was pulling apart chicken.  Re-introduced reduction and added remainder of 4oz sauce I had from before.  This is a 10/10.  The other great pulled chicken recipes are buffalo or salsa taco style pulled.

userID:
18270346
Display Name:
ChrisMoPro
isPro:
False
followersCount:

5

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/3730359.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I love this idea. The instructions, however, need a bit of tweaking. I used fresh (not frozen) chicken breasts. I cut them once length wise to help them cook a little more thoroughly (and quickly). You can use as much or as little chicken as you think you'll need. I usually use more and use the leftovers later.

I used Stubb's Sweet and Sticky BBQ Sauce, a zesty italian dressing (Kraft).

I added all of the ingredients together in a bowl and poured it over the chicken in the crock pot.
I cooked the chicken on high for about 3 hours (stirring it every hour or so, if possible). I checked the internal temp of the chicken to help monitor its progress.
When the chicken was cooked (just about the 3 hour mark), I removed the chicken and shredded it with a couple of forks.
I added the chicken back into the crock pot and stirred it up. 
Changed the heat to medium (or keep warm).
You can add flour to the mix if its a little runny.

Serve the chicken on toasted kaiser rolls with cheese and lettuce and a side of steak fries.

Using the leftover chicken mix as a BBQ chicken topper.
Review:
Rating:
4

Followed the recipe and was skeptical about cooking it for 4 hours on high in my slow cooker (was afraid it would dry out), but the chicken was tender and delicious! One of my picky preschoolers even ate it. My husband and I really liked it. The sauce was more watery than I would have liked and made the hamburger buns on which I served it a little soggy. None
text:
This is requested often for parties/camping. I cook the chicken (frozen-but thawed overnight in fridge) in the slow cooker with onion and chicken broth on high 4hours. I then drain/shred and return to the slow cooker on low with the bbq mix (I always use sweet baby rays) while I get ready for the party (usually at least 30 mins-sometimes a few hours). My kids cheer when they discover I'm making it! So easy.

text:
Thanks to reviews, I made sure to use good quality bbq sauce.  Yes, the sauce was thin while cooking but I think that is because of the amount of saline that groceries inject into the chicken, so there is no way around all that extra  liquid cooking out into the sauce.  I also used the tip from others to shred the meat and cook it for a bit in the sauce and I think  this improved the flavor quite a bit.

text:
EASY FINE. We thought this was fine. My husband loves things
over baked potatoes. I made totally as directed. I read the comments about bland. I decided all these strong flavours would be fine with me. For  some reason it is bland ....I like everything about this recipe for certain occasions, but I am going to work on punching this up a bit next time.   Left overs. This was great. I drizzled a small layer  medium salsa sauce over bottom of 9/11 dish rolled a good bit of meat in tortilla and placed in dish spread rest of salsa over top. Top with cheese bake . Add salad. So good, so easy. May add peas or something next time.
Will definitely be making this again. Easy to make, great to have on hand. 2nd time. This has become a 5 for us. Who knew? This time I added red pepper flakes. Perfect. Be careful though,  it gets hotter as time goes on.

text:
Love this recipe ! I use six chicken breasts and two of the big bottles of Sweet Baby Rays. I layer the bottom of the crock pot with one bottle, put the chicken in. I then cover the chicken in the other bottle of bbq sauce. Lastly I add the rest of the ingredients.  Always cook on high and I don't have to pull the chick apart because it just falls apart on its own.

text:
The most phenomenal slow cooker recipe I've ever tried. I used Imo's Italian salad dressing, which is a Missouri specialty, along with a hickory honey bbq sauce. Don't go cheap with your ingredients and you'll be rewarded. Cooked for five hours on high and it was cooked perfectly. Shredded my chicken, then put it back on low for fifteen minutes to soak of the sauce before serving it on a toasted potato bread bun. It's tangy, spicy, sweet, tender... I can't recommend this recipe enough. For one person it's enough for probably eight meals if not more, and I've been eating it pretty much breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I want to cry tears of joy every time I take a bite- it's THAT good.

I was pleasantly surprised at how this turned out. I adjusted the serving size to two and followed the proportions. I agree with the reviewers that the quality of the barbecue sauce and the Italian dressing makes a huge difference. I added sautéed onions, garlic, and red chili powder. I didn't have Worcestershire sauce and I didn't miss it. Another thing- you have to know your slow cooker. Mine was done in two hours and it was not watery at all. I'll definitely make this again. Thanks for sharing the recipe!

text:
This is a great recipe for chicken BBQ.  I just use a little less brown sugar, and I use Sweet Baby Ray's original for the sauce. I used Zesty Italian Dressing, which is what this recipe is named for and other versions of the recipe call for. The dressing really makes this better than other crock pot recipes I've tried. I don't use frozen breasts, and I find the perfect time for my slow cooker is 1 hour on high and then 3 hours on low. The leftovers are great in a quesadilla or put over a baked potato.

text:
This was a great foundation. Love the idea. I used all of the ingredients and added a few more. I used Stubbs Hickory Bourbon sauce, used a package of dry Italian seasoning instead of the dressing,  added 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar, tbls. Smoked paprika, half bottle of stout beer. Cooked 6 hours on low. Shredded the chicken in the pot in the sauce and let it cook another hour so the chicken absorbed up much of the sauce. By the time it was done, almost all the sauce was gone but just enough that it was nice and moist and juicy. Next time, I'm going to do my chipotle chicken wraps this way. Delicious and effortless!

Display Name:
Covergirl

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614248.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was super easy and sooooooo good! I washed, trimmed, and seasoned my frozen chicken breast with garlic powder and cajun seasoning. I used Sweet Baby Ray's Sweet & Spicy Bbq sauce, Olive Garden Italian dressing, Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce, and only 1/3 cup of brown sugar (since the bbq sauce is already sweet). I added chopped onions, lemon juice from half a lemon, and 2 teaspoons of Liquid Smoke to the sauce before pouring it over the chicken. I cooked it on high for 3hrs, removed the chicken to shred, and returned it to the pot. I cooked it for 1hr more after that. Served it on a toasted jumbo bun. It was absolutely delicious!!! I will definitely kerp this recipe in rotation.

country:
None
text:
I made this dish a couple of times and finally got it tweaked to where we all love it. I use fresh or thawed chicken cutlets.    I added half of a sliced onion at the bottom of the slow cooker before I placed the chicken on top.  In addition, I added a tsp of liquid smoke and cut the sugar to 1 tbs instead of the 1/4 cup.  My family found that the 1/4 cup brown sugar made it a little too sweet.  I used Dinosaur bbq sauce and it was delicious.  I also followed some of the other reviews and only cooked it for 3 hours on high, shredded the chicken and added it back to the pot and then cooked it for another half hour on high.

text:
I made this using a recommendation of another reviewer.  First I used a combination of chicken breasts (1lb) and boneless thighs (3lb). I cooked it for 3 hours on high with 12 oz of chicken broth and a sprinkle of garlic powder on the chicken.  I drained almost all of the chicken broth.  Then I added the rest of the ingredients and cooked on low for another hour.

region:

country:
None
text:
Luvs2seeUeat Review: Did not have Italian dressing--oops! I did not choose to go back to the grocery store either. So instead of Italian Dressing, I added a little dried onion soup mix, [about 3 tsp], and 1/4 cup of low salt chicken broth, and a tsp of garlic paste to all of the other ingredients and mixed the ingredients together; tossed it on the marinaded boneless chicken in the slower cooker [with a liner of course] and cooked it  for 3 and a half hours on high. After shredding the chicken, I added a tad more chicken broth and Kraft Honey Barbecue sauce, mixed it together and left the chicken in the slow cooker on low for 20 minutes and turned it to warm and everyone spooned the chicken on fresh rolls right from the slow cooker [to avoid a lot of clean-up]. Along with a spinach salad, this was an easy and delicious dinner!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great meal! I followed the directions from the recipe and took some advice from other reviewers. I used 6 fresh chicken breasts and Olive Garden Italian dressing and Sweet Baby Ray's Honey Barbeque (this may have made the meal a little too sweet, so I'll go with a spicier bbq sauce next time or add hot sauce). 

I added diced onions and cooked for 3 hours on high,  shredded the chicken, added some flour to the juice, put the chicken back in, and cooked on low for 30 minutes. The chicken was perfectly done. We ate the chicken on sandwiches with dill pickle chips and blue cheese on the side. Pickles are a must! It was really good! 

To make it even better, I will do something to lighten the sweetness a bit next time. That could mean adding less flour, watering the juice down a little bit, and  adding the onions later. I could also try using less sugar or a different (maybe spicier) barbeque sauce. I will also get some cole slaw for the side.

text:
This recipe was a hit at my house. I cooked the chicken breasts (from frozen) for 4 hours, then pulled them apart with two forks and cooked it for another hour in the juices. I didn't have Italian dressing so I looked up an easy recipe to make my own with olive oil and spices (e.g., oregano, basil, etc.) Also FTR I used Bull's Eye Original BBQ sauce. I'll probably halve the sugar next time since I found it a bit on the sweet side, but I will definitely make it again! We had it with mashed potatoes and roasted broccoli but I can totally see this being good in a bun too.

I have made this 3 times now. First time, I forgot to half the chicken so it was good but it was more like BBQ chicken and didn't pull apart to go on a sandwich. The 2nd time we remembered to half the chicken and it was a disaster..followed the time directions exactly but came home to burnt overcooked chicken and sauce. That time it turned out very good but still working on trying to fine tune it because we can't always be here to monitor dinner all day.

text:
This was good. It was the first time I have ever used a slow cooker. 

As per some of the other mentions, I added some diced onions and a dash of liquid smoke to the mix. I made my own Italian dressing that I found on food.com (it's not a dressing normally in our home). 

I have a Breville "fast slow cooker" and since it doesn't have a high setting (ironic given the name but it's for the pressure cooker aspect), I had it on for 6 hours, shredded the chicken and then used the sear setting to reduce some of the liquid. 

I'm looking forward to using the leftovers!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is a great recipe!!  It is important to use a decent BBQ sauce, so use your favorite kind. The only 2 changes I make: 1) I use a mixture of chicken thighs and breasts about 8- 10 pieces (skinless), once the meat cooks in the sauce I remove any fat and bones while shredding the fully cooked meat then I dump out the cooked, watery sauce then 2) I make a fresh round of the sauce mixture and replace the shredded meat in the crock pot on warm or low setting for an hour with the new sauce mix.  This turns up the flavor and makes it extra moist! Love this recipe

text:
I agree that the cooking time & temperature is incorrect.  After 2 hours on high, the sauce began to burn.  It ending up cooking 2 hours on high & 2 hours on low.  I used KC Masterpiece Original BBQ Sauce & Kraft Italian dressing.  I also used fresh chicken breasts.  There is no need to shred the chicken.  Stir with a fork every now and then & the chicken will pull apart on its own.  Great tasting & easy recipe.

text:
I didn't have italian salad dressing on hand, so I made some italian dressing mix up and put a little in together with a dash of olive oil and a dash or two of vinegar. 

An hour before I served it was a little watery so I shredded the chicken, mixed in a little cornstarch and left the lid off.  

My meat eating family loved it. I think we'll use the leftovers for a bbq chicken pizza tomorrow night!

JulieM

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614242.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is my go-to bbq chicken recipe and everyone raves about it. I make mine almost exactly following the recipe, but add 1 small chopped onion, as others have suggested. It does depend on the bbq sauce you use on whether it's sweet, tangy, or spicy. I've makes it with many types and I think most people tend to love it the most with honey BBQ sauce. I've also played around with adding honey in addition to the brown sugar and I don't think it changed it much. I put it in the crock pot for 3 hours on high, then pull the chicken with 2 forks, and then let it sit in the crock pot and soak up the sauce for another hour. You and your guest will love it!

None
country:
None
text:
Too sweet! I used Sweet Baby Ray's Original BBQ sauce. I followed recipe's measurements exactly for the BBQ sauce, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and Italian dressing. I did add a few splashes of liquid smoke and liquid garlic (neither of which should have adversely affected the sweetness or flavor).  Next time, I won't bother with the brown sugar or just put 1/4 of the recipe's measurement. Yes, it was that sweet. Also, I didn't care for the tang of the Italian dressing. I'll omit that next time.  I slow cooked on high for 4 hours lid on, shredded the chicken with a fork, then 1 hour on high lid off.  The chicken was juicy and tender. I served slider-style on dinner rolls.

Love this recipe! It was so easy to put together and came out great! Lots of flavor and the chicken was very tender. I followed this recipe as it's written, only add about a 1/2 of chopped onion and 3 cloves of garlic. text:
For someone who is not a "pulled pork" fan, I really didn't think I'd care much for the "pulled chicken"... But OMG this was great!  I am not much of a cook, I do some online recipes here and there, but this was definitely one I will make again.  My husband loved this recipe!  Looking at some of the reviews I was worried it would be a bit watery... But once I shredded the chicken after I cooked it for 3 hours on high in my slow cooker, the sauce thickened up and it was just perfect!  FOLLOW the recipe timing!  3 Hours on High, shred chicken add back to slow cooker, 1 hour on low!  Great Recipe!!!!

text:
Honestly, slow cookers (crock pots) are the Best thing to cook in. You can just throw things in the pot the morning of and turn on high, before you know it you come home from school and the whole house just smells divine.  I’ve never personally had chicken barbeque in a crockpot but this recipe, I’m Definitely Trying! I love chicken and I love barbeque so this is a MUST. The ingredients needed for this recipe are simple and easy, but I don’t know about the Italian dressing. I don’t know well it will taste if I incorporate it in this recipe. The picture looks so delectable and I am seriously about to make this recipe when I am done writing this review. I plan to make it for my roommates and myself. But since there is little ingredients, it should be fairly simple. I will be sure to update how it goes! But 4 stars for simplicity!

text:
This is such an easy recipe.  I use homemade Italian dressing,  "Italian Dressing Mix" from this site.  I always have a big batch of the dry mix ready, so whipping some Italian dressing takes 2 minutes.  I use about a cup of dressing so the chicken has a good amount of sauce.  When I don't have all day to let the chicken cook, I cut the breasts horizontally and set my crock pot to high, and it cooks in about 2 hours.  My husband likes it best as a sandwich, but the kids and I like it best over rice.  My family LOVES this recipe.  And I LOVE how totally easy it is.

Phenomenal food!  Used a modified recipe: didn't add dressing, used BBQ sauce with the other ingredients (KC), added cooked julienned (1" long) white onions after 4 hours & cooked it in crock pot for a total of 6 hours on Low.  Toasted kaiser rolls brushed with extra virgin olive oil & garlic powder.  Added muenster cheese to the sandwiches, served open or closed face, which made it heavenly!  The only downside was smelling this cooking for 6 hours. :). Mmmmm!!

userID:
3824854
Display Name:
slugger
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
8
favoritesCount:
0
recipesCount:

reviewsCount:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674138.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is a great recipe, although I did make some changes to lessen the sweetness, since we like things less sweet.  I used a recipe for BBQ sauce that I found on another web site (Cooking Light) posted in the community (it's called Chuck's Famous BBQ Sauce), and I made some changes to that.  My most important addition to the bbq sauce recipe is about half a bottle of McCormick Montreal Steak Sauce.  I would've added more if I'd had more.  That really made some of the best bbq sauce I've ever had.  I didn't have the called-for molasses, so I Googled substitutions, and brown sugar was recommended for things which need the flavor of molasses (3/4 c to 1 c molasses).   I also had to subst. onion powder for minced onion since I didn't have that on hand.  I used Apple Cider Vinegar for the vinegar.  Then, I noticed a bit late that the chicken recipe required Italian Salad dressing; I didn't have any of that either, so I looked up and found a fabulous dressing mix on this web site (the best!).  I mixed that up with tarragon vinegar as well as the called-for oil, water and dry mix. Really, this allrecipes web site truly does have some of the best recipes.  Yes, I know.  It takes extra time to "make your own" and I might have saved a lot of time by simply going to the nearby grocery store to buy both bbq sauce and Italian salad dressing; but, if I'd done that, I would've missed out on discovering some very good "from scratch" versions.  If you have extra time, I highly suggest it.

Rating:
5
dateLastModified:

text:
I thought this recipe was sooo good! I couldn't quite find a good recipe for BBQ shredded chicken sandwiches and finally I can say I did! I changed the servings to 3 and followed all those directions (I maybe used a little more BBQ sauce and used fresh chicken), cooked on low for about 6 hours, it did seem kinda watery before shredding the chicken, but once I shredded the chicken, I left it in for maybe another hour at most and it soaked all that liquid up making the recipe perfect!! I will definitely use this recipe again, it was so easy!  With the leftovers, I plan to use those in quesadillas or a salad like many other reviewers said they did.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Turned out great, although I had to make the following adjustments based on what I had on hand. For sauce I used 2 Fat Guys BBQ sauce - approx 8 oz, Trader Joe's Caesar Parmesan dressing - approx 1/4 cup, 1 tsp brown sugar. Chopped up garlic and put that on the chicken, then poured the sauce mix over it. Used 4 thawed chicken breasts, cooked on low for 1 hour, high for 3 more, shredded the chicken, added the rest of the jar of the 2 fat guys bbq sauce, and cooked 1 more hour on low. (BTW, shredding the chicken made a world of difference, it soaked up all the watery sauce and adding the extra sauce gave the perfect ratio of meat to sauce) Everyone loved it!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Somehow the review I left is gone so I decided to leave it again. The first time, I gave this one 4 stars but now am changing it to 5 stars after making this dish again. I used famous dave's sweet and zesty the first time and this time, I used original flavor. I think the original is better. Now mine comes out a bit soupy which disappointed me a bit at first but we actually used that soupy stuff for bbq spaghetti. Oh, boy was it good! We simply poured it over linguine, topped it with colby jack and chopped green onions(just like a restaurant in my areas serves except they serve it with pulled pork). I packed the leftover for my hubby's lunch and he said it was REALLY REALLY good even reheated. He said he had wished there were some more. So I made it again. This time, I did put one more piece of chicken(last time, I put 4 breasts and 3 tenders but this time just 5 pcs of breasts). It was not as soupy as last time but better for bbq spaghetti. I thickened the sauce a bit with starch(1 spoon of starch and 1 spoon of water- thought about doing it 2 but was afraid that it would make it too thick). I did add half an onion both times. It's just so easy to make and the result is so good. I think we'll stick to original flavor sauce from now. I thawed chicken in the water and soaked them in milk after that to get rid of chicken smell(Yes, I am quite sensitive to smell). So it adds a bit more work than called for but is definitely worth it. It goes well with tabasco, too or jalepeno.

None
text:
We don't like sweet BBQ, so I used Rudy's "Sissy BBQ Sauce" with the Italian dressing. Added a little extra olive oil, a couple cloves of minced garlic & skipped the brown sugar.  After shredding, to me it was lacking flavor, so I opted to make a sort of texmex dish by adding some chopped green chiles, chile powder, cumin and oregano.  We served it on toasted hoagie rolls with 'Spanish slaw' (shredded cabagge tossed with Italian dressing).  I thought this was good, and my husband just raved about it.  So thanks!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674159.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Panic! We had 10 people coming for a birthday party, and I made the zesty slow cooker chicken barbecue. I doubled the recipe; could that have caused it not to cook? Began it just before noon, on 'low.' At 3, I tried to shred it with 2 forks. No go! The chicken breasts seemed like blobs of uncooked poultry; they were still frozen. I turned the cooker up to 'high' and let another hour go by. Still nowhere near being ready to shred. Then, a few at a time, I put the breasts in the microwave; after about a half hour of microwaving and slicing with a knife rather than shredding, it all went back into the slow cooker, still on 'high.' At about 6:30 I took a deep breath and served it. Wonderful! The guests loved it, said the recipe's a "keeper" and only I knew what had gone into trying to get this easy meal ready to serve.
Review:
Rating:
5

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674168.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
While trying to figure out what to cook for an upcoming potluck I ran across this recipe. Used 3 frozen boneless/skinless chicken breasts & some tenderloin pieces I wanted to get rid of. Cooked it using Sweet Baby Rays sauce plus about 1/4 cup of Yoshida's Sweet Chili Sauce. I set it for 8 hours & took the chicken out at about 6 hours, set side to cool & shred. I left the top off the remaining liquid in the crock to continue cooking. About 45 min. later I put the shredded chicken back in (no lid) and let it heat back up for about 1/2 hour. I did wind up adding in a healthy squirt of BBQ sauce while it was heating back up because it had soaked up a lot of the sauce.  It was very good & I'm gonna make sliders for the potluck out of it.  If it was all adults I'd probably add in some garlic and red onion, but since there will be kids I'll keep it as is for now. Best of all I can make it the day before & let flavors meld. Very good, very easy and beats the heck out of the store bought stuff with all the additives in it.

text:
Made this last night and served on a whole wheat bun with roasted baby potatoes and corn. My VERY picky 4 year old liked it and that says a lot considering she hates trying new food and only seems to like chicken nuggets and pizza! So this will go into our rotation. I followed the recipe except I halved it for three chicken breasts, used fresh chicken instead of frozen, Sweet Baby Rays Original BBQ Sauce, Newman's own light italian dressing and seasoned the chicken breasts with garlic and onion powder and a little salt and pepper. I will make this again. Easy recipe, easy cleanup. I had no trouble with the end result being watery. After I shredded the chicken (an hour before done, as suggested by many reviewers), it was perfect. I cooked this on high for about 3 and a half hours.

A terrific recipe.  I followed it nearly to the letter.  Only difference was I used fresh chicken instead of frozen.  I cooked it for 4 hours in the slow cooker and it was great.  Like others, I shredded it after 3 hours and then threw it back in for the final hour of cooking. city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe was simple and enjoyable ... make sure that you use a good BBQ sauce. There are a number of good ones available, but the cheaper ones don't do as well. Adjustments that I made to the recipe include - adding: 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander, some dry rub, garlic and about 1 tablespoon of cayenne pepper. Since we made a larger portion, I added in corn starch (3 teaspoons) in order to thicken the sauce. Finally, we sauteed onions and served on kaiser rolls. For those who did not want bread, the meat was served on a salad. On a salad, this was excellent!

text:
I made this yesterday using a whole chicken (just had to pull apart with forks and pick out the bones towards the end of the 4 hours on high). It was definitely tender and flavorful. I had to drain at about 3 hours in to ensure the sauce be thick since it was a bit watery for our taste. I used Bullseye BBQ sauce and Zesty italian dressing since that is what I had on hand. The Bullseye sauce is very bold so it was the dominant flavor. Maybe next time I will use a milder, less smokey sauce. Overall a tasty dish served pulled over rice and onions. Thank you Zanne Tastic for sharing :)

text:
I made this recipe a couple days ago for my boyfriend and I and it's already gone. I usually cut recipes in half since it's just the two of us, but I should have made the full 6 serving recipe on this one. I took advice from previous reviews and added diced red onion (1/2), 2 cloves of garlic, and 1Tbs liquid smoke. I used Jack Daniels honey BBQ and Wishbone Italian dressing. Instead of serving it on a bun I served it on sweet potatoes and topped it with pickles and red onion. My bf also loves pickled jalepenos so he added those...but I'm not sure I'd recommend that concoction across the board. We loved it! Thanks for sharing :)

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Easy and tasty. I used a pkg of boneless, skinless thighs because that's my preference for taste and shredding ease. My crockpot is a beast, so I had this dinner on the table in less than 3 hours start to finish. I recommend using a packet of Italian dressing to taste instead of the liquid variety. Used Sweet Baby Ray's Hickory & Brown Sugar and added a small, sauteed sweet onion about an hour before done. Served on whole wheat buns toasted with a little butter and garlic powder, a sprinkling of cheddar cheese (some extra raw onion for me), some butter lettuce, and a side of sweet potato fries. This will remain on the rotation...thanks!

text:
This is such an amazing recipe!  I was a bit skeptical about the italian dressing, but it turned out great.  Like other reviewers have suggested, its very important to use fresh chicken, or have it fully thawed before putting it in the slow cooker.  I followed the advice of another reviewer and 'pulled' the chicken after 3 hours on high, then put it back in for 1 other hour.  I did find that it was a bit too liquidy, but my boyfriend said it was perfect!  DELICIOUS awesome recipe!

text:
Loved the reviews so I just had to try this one. I cut the recipe in half thinking that since it was only to feed two adults and three young children the full recipe would be way too much. Boy was I wrong, while the amount definitely would have been plenty normally, this was so tasty that all three of my kids gobbled it right up and were asking for more (even my picky almost 2 year old!!!) I will definitely be making this one again and making the full recipe so that we may even get some leftovers next time around! I didn't even tweak the recipe at all like I typically do with anything that I make- it was delicious just the way it was! Thanks for sharing this has quickly become a family favorite and I have already been having requests to make it again! :-)

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was a great recipe! Very easy, very hands off. I followed the recipe exactly (a little bit less Italian dressing). I used a value pack of chicken from Trader Joe's of 3 boneless, skinless chicken breasts with rib meat- it was roughly about 3 pounds of meat. I had to remove the tendon, but it saved me a lot of money. I cooked it on high for 3 hours, then turned it down to low for 1 hour. Then, I shredded it by pulling it apart with 2 forks and mixed it up with the sauce and kept it on warm until my guests arrived. I served it with whole wheat buns, and everyone liked it.

text:
Very delicious recipe.  Instead of frozen chicken I used Chicken breast halves (which is on the bone) and I cooked on high in my crock pot for 3 hours in a can of chicken broth.  I then strained out the juice and fat and shredded the chicken, putting the chicken back in the crock pot with the bbq mixture I cooked on low for one more hour.  Chicken was so tender and juicy! Tasted great on Kaiser rolls with red onion and cheddar cheese.

text:
Fantastic!  I used about 1 1/2 lbs of boneless breast tenders and used my 2 quart slow cooker on high setting and the chicken was done and ready to be shredded in about 3 1/2 hours.  I added chopped green pepper and onions just because I needed to use them up.  The remaining sauce was a bit watery so I added a heaping tablespoon of flour and it rethickened nicely.  Will definately be making this one again!

text:
This turned out awesome and was VERY easy to make as well.  Didnt have the Italian dressing so I used a Rasberry Vinegrette. Also, read about the runny consistancy at the end by a few viewers so I made sure my chicken WAS thawed, but after it was done there was still alot of juice. So, since I made this ahead of time, I seperated the meat from the juice and when it came time to eat the next day, I just added it all to a pan on the stove and added about a cup or so of just the BBQ sauce I used, which was Sweet Baby Rays, and it turned out AWESOME!

I used Wegman's Brown Sugar BBQ sauce (so I didn't need to add brown sugar)and prepared an Italian Dressing sauce from a packet. Used 4 frozen chicken breasts (large) and shredded at about 5 hours.  Put back in slow cooker in remaining sauce and cooked on low about 30 more minutes. This was excellent, made a lot of food and my husband, who is picky, said it was at least as good as any you would get at a restaurant.

text:
This is another one of those slow cooker recipes that needs a different rating system.  There's a value balance for the ease factor.  The ease factor bonus applies here.  You don't even have to thaw out the chicken!  Just throw it all in there, and see ya later.  6-8 hours later, you have some decent BBQ chicken sandwiches.  Certainly not as good as chicken you've smoked on the grill, but it'll do in a pinch.

Great recipe, definately share-worthy! Thank you.

text:
SOOOO good! I cooked 4.5 defrosted bonesless skinless chicken breasts, used 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1 tbsp worchestchire, 1/2 cup Kraft Zesty Italian dressing and 20 oz of Sweet Baby Rays. I Put half the sauce mixture in, cooked 3 hrs on high in my crock pot, pulled the meat apart, added the other half of the sauce and let it soak in the sauce for another 30 min with the crock pot off. It was quite saucy but we like it that way. Even my picky 2 yr old gobbled it up!

I followed the instructions above with 6 chicken breasts, but I did defrost them first. I used Sweet Baby Rays Sweet and Spicy BBQ sauce (18oz). text:
Simple, easy, and as fast as your slow cooker lets you go. We've used a variety of acidic items in place of the Italian dressing, from red wine vinegar and olive oil to the Southwest dressing packets from McDonalds, and it still works. Versatile and great for families. Do strain the fat from the remaining jus in your slow cooker, and it can be used as a sauce.

Loved this recipe, I did thaw out my chicken first, I know it is not safe to put frozen chicken in a slow cooker. This was such a easy recipe and the smell in the house when it was cooking was amazing. I really didnt change anything, I took the chicken out a couple hour's before it was done and shredded it and then put it back in the slow cooker and let it cook and blend together. I only made it with 2 breasts, because it would have been way to much for the two of us, so I used about a half of the bottle of BBQ sauce. I still had leftovers, will be making again yum

text:
Simple and delicious. IF you are like me and make your own homemade vinegar based BBQ sauce, it will still be good in this, you'll just need to add a little more brown sugar and maybe molasses. I fed masses of people with 6 fresh chicken breasts and I still have leftovers! Served it on fresh buns from Costco, will probably try it as topping for BBQ salad next. This is the simplest Labor Day BBQ Ever, thanks to this fabulous recipe.

As a lot of people know...I rate based on whether my husband and/or kids enjoy it because they are so picky.  My husband began eating the liquid like it was soup out of the pot before I could even serve it!  He LOVED it!  I didn't change one thing!  Here is how I served it: I separated the chicken from the liquid and shredded it.  I served it on sub rolls and poured the juice into small individual bowls for dipping the sandwiches in.  Sort of like...French Dip.  Was great!!!

text:
EXCELLENT & EASY!! I used a whole cut up raw chicken, put in crock with rest of ingredients, cooked on low for 4.5 hrs then shredded chicken, put back in for another 2 hrs. NOTE: 30 mins before done, sprinkled some cornstarch to thicken, might not have needed it but I didn't want it too thin -- the shredded chick does thicken the sauce. The smell throughout the day was amazing! I served on toasted Kaiser rolls w/coleslaw & sliced watermelon. Everyone ate these so fast I didn't get a chance to take a picture! Teens used leftovers for everything from burritos to omelets! GREAT RECIPE!! YUMMM

text:
It was very good. I made this for 2 people +leftovers only. I didn't have  italian dressing so I added 1/4 cup balsamic fig dressing. I added some (maybe 1/4 or less) molasses since my bbq sauce was vinegar based; less bbq sauce (because of the previous addition), and a few drops of siracha for spice. It also went well served with raw red onions.

Thank you to previous reviewers for the tips (about the molasses and the red onions). I wouldn't be afraid to sub for the italian dressing, as my version (based on what I had in my pantry) turned out fantastic. I don't think I'll make pulled pork again; this was as good (and a lil' bit less fatty)

Display Name:
Michelle

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5677176.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have never written a review before but I make this recipe all the time. It is a favorite among my family. I made it at a family gathering and it was a hit. It is a great crock pot recipe! I do make some changes. First, I only use Famous Daves BBQ sauce. I have used other sauces and this one gives the recipe the best taste. The Texas Pit flavour combined with zesty itallian dressing makes the chicken tangy though. I only use 3 or 4 FRESH chicken breasts, I never cook frozen meat. I make this two ways, one way is I cook the chicken in the crock pot on low for 4 hours using chicken broth first. Then drain and shredd the chicken. I add the BBQ sauce and cook on low for another 1-2 hours. The second way is I cook the chicken in the BBQ sauce on low 4-6 hours then shredd the chicken as stated in the recipe. I have had my chicken come out dry, to combat that I make another batch or 1/2 batch of BBQ sauce, depending on your tastes.

country:

text:
I haven't reviewed many recipes, but this one has been such a lifesaver for me.  I have used this recipe so many times, and the key is that I make my own barbecue sauce.  I mix ketchup, brown sugar, a little molasses, liquid smoke, onion powder, salt & pepper to taste.  The liquid smoke makes this taste a lot like pulled pork.  My husband is a huge pulled pork fan, and he loved this and said he thought it was pork before I told him!!  I don't add the extra brown sugar since my sauce sweetens it enough with the brown sugar and molasses I add to it.  Doing the chicken breasts frozen works the best for me, because usually chicken breasts dry out so fast when they are put in thawed.  Wonderful recipe! Thank you for posting!

It's hard to find a 12-oz bottle of BBQ sauce, though. So I'd go for saying 1 1/2 cups instead.
I also had thirsty breasts, so next time I'll be adding extra liquids so there's plenty of sauce.

text:
I've made this several times. This is a great crowd pleaser. The better the BBQ sauce the better the way the recipe turns out. Once the chicken is cooked until tender I pull it out of the crockpot and shred it and put it back into the crockpot where it absorbs much of the sauce. I usually add additional BBQ sauce just prior to serving otherwise the sauce is too thin. This reheats well and freezes well also.

text:
About the sauce: I used Famous Dave's Rich & Sassy BBQ sauce as recommended by another reviewer. I personally won't be using that kind again - it turned out a bit tangy. 

I also didn't have time to put it in the slow cooker so I boiled/shredded the chicken and let it simmer on the stove for 35-40 minutes. It turned out great this way! My boyfriend and I both really enjoyed it, though again next time I'd use a different BBQ sauce.

text:
This recipe was great and very simple.  I am always looking for new ways to cook chicken in the crock pot.  I have now tried this recipe twice with chicken and once with a 4½ lb pork shoulder.  Every time I make it everyone raves about how good it taste.  The only change I made is that I added a small amount of fresh garlic.  I have also tried using a few different types of BBQ sauce.  I have used Kraft original and Jack Daniels Hickory and Brown Sugar.  Both came out great, but the Jack Daniels one was a little bit tangier.  I will definitely be adding this to my family cookbook.

text:
fabulous for a lean pork loin as well.   I put water in a croclk pot,  seasoned the 2.25 pork loin with mesqite chicken seasoning, and tossed the meat in to cook for  6 hours.  Just enough water to cover the meat.  Then I removed meat carefully, dumped the water and added the sauce mixture using Jack Daniel Hickory & brown sugar BBQ sauce. A new family favorite and great for evening tailgates.

text:
I always struggle with what to eat after church, we cant afford to go out every sunday, and I dont want to have to get home from church and spend an hour in the kitchen when everyone is starving, so this looked perfect. I used boneless skinless chicken breast strips and did everything else just like the recipe. It was really good, hubby didnt like the extra liquid in it and I wasnt crazy about the watery-ness, but it did have great flavor, it was even better then next day because some of the water seemed to soak up in the chicken. I think im going to freeze some and use it to make nachos or something down the road. Thank you for a great idea. I will make again, but maybe half of the sald dressing, or maybe ill add the bbq sauce and dressing after its shredded so i can eyeball the amount of sauce we like.
